alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:28PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Humboldt and northwestern Elko Counties through 300 PM PDT... At 227 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 20 miles northeast of Paradise Valley, one cell moving northeast at 20 mph while the southern cell is stationary. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Humboldt and northwestern Elko Counties. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
